note: Floating-point operations are needed for very large or very small real numbers, or computations that require a large dynamic range. Floating-point operations per second are therefore a more accurate measure than instructions per second.
title: Computational capacity of the fastest supercomputers

flop.title: Floating-point operation
flop.content: A floating-point operation (FLOP) is a type of computer operation. One FLOP is equivalent to one addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division of two decimal numbers.

subtitle: Number of [floating-point operations](hover::general::flop) carried out per second by the fastest supercomputer in any given year.
